trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomosed time series study investigating the effects of a community based group behavioural parenting proram for the treatment of child overweight and obesity.

interventions.interventions: A psychoeducational group behavioural parenting program involving 4 two hour weekly group sessions and a 3mth follow up booster session. Key intervention components involved knowlege about overweight, nutrition, physical activity and motivation.
interventions.comparator: The waist list control group did not recieve any treatment or support initially but were allocated into a treatment group after 3 mths on the wait list.

primaryOutcome.outcome: 1) Child and parent/primary carer: Body Mass Index score, waist circumference
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Outcomes will be collected for the treatment group at baseline (1 week before tretment) and 3 mths post treatment while the waitlist control group outcomes will be collected 3 mth before, baseline (1 week before treatment) and 3 mths post treatment.

primaryOutcome.outcome: 2) Child daily: energy consumption, media viewing, physical activity
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Outcomes will be collected for the treatment group at baseline (1 week before tretment) and 3 mths post treatment while the waitlist control group outcomes will be collected 3 mth before, baseline (1 week before treatment) and 3 mths post treatment.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Parental behaviours involving parenting style (The Parenting Scale), conflict (The Parent Problem Checklist), satisfaction (Parenting Sense of Competence Scale). 2) Participant satisfaction via a parent questionaire.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: These outcomes will be collected for the treatment group at baseline (1 week before tretment) and 3 mths post treatment while the waitlist control group outcomes will be collected 3 mth before, baseline (1 week before treatment) and 3 mths post treatment.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Families included if: child between 3 and 10-years-old, had BMI at or greater than 85th percentile after adjusting for age/gender; one parent/primary care-giver attends all assessment and treatment sessions. Parents/caregivers are required to read a treatment manual and complete a child food intake and physical activity and media viewing monitoring inventories.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Presence of a medical diagnosis for childs weight, or if either parent or child has a disability causing dietary or exercise restrictions.

fundingsource.fundingname: Queensland Health, Golden Casket Working Wonders grant

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
The aim is to develop/evaluate a group behavioural program for parents that targets overweight/obese children aged 3 to 10 years.
It is thought that participation will result in: reduced child BMI scores, reduced energy intake, reduced media viewing, increased activity levels; and reduced primary parent BMI scores. These changes are thought to be able to be maintained three months after treatment.
Parental participation will hopefully result in improved parenting behaviour. These will be indicated by improved scores on parental self report measures of consistency, sense of satisfaction/efficacy and inter-parental conflict.
